articles.title: Developped Tools
articles.contents:
mFD R Package and associated tutorials
During my PhD, I have developped the mFD R package which computes and plots functional diversity indices.

It is currently available on CRAN and Github for the development version.
Its website goes with a set of tutorials to help to go through the functional analysis process.
Website on the basics of Code Reproductibility in R
During on a project made during a teaching unit done by the FRB-CESAB in Montpellier (December 2021),
two other PhD students and I have build a website on the basics of Code Reproductibility. Lena Klay, Erwan Harscouet and I hope that this PokeReproductibility website can help newcomers in the Reproductibility to understand the key concepts!

articles.title: Camille Magneville
articles.contents:
Figure 1: Coral Reefs from Mayotte (Indian Ocean)



Hi! üëã



I have been captivated by nature ever since my childhood, when I first began
exploring the trails of the Alps. The complexity of nature is immense, and we
have only scratched the surface of our understanding of natural ecosystems
functioning.
When examining a species community, diversity is often measured in terms of
species richness, but it can also be observed through the lens of species
functional strategies, known as functional diversity.
As a functional ecologist, my research aims to
increase our understanding on how ecosystems are functioning and
how human activity can impact this functioning.
I studied different taxa and scales which has led me to be more motivated by the
research question itself rather than by the taxa it applies to. I like to improve
methodologies to precise species functional role.

articles.title: Research
articles.contents:
DRIVERS OF MEDITERRANEAN FORESTS TAXONOMIC, FUNCTIONAL AND PHYLOGENETIC DIVERSITY & ITS EVOLUTION ACROSS FUTURE SCENARIOS (Sept 2023 - Sept 2026)
I am beginning a Postdoc at the ECONOVO Center
and Aarhus University (Denmark).
I am studying the relative importance of current and past environmental
conditions and biotic interactions in shaping taxonomic, functional and
phylogenetic diversity patterns. Once this knowledge has been acquired, I will
be focusing on how these diversity facets evolve across different
socio-economical scenarios and assessing species vunerability to land-use and
climate change.
This work is part of the INTEGRADIV
Biodiversa project.
FUNCTIONAL DIVERSITY OF FISHES IN COASTAL MARINE ECOSYSTEMS AND ITS TEMPORAL VARIABILITY (PhD thesis - 2019 - 2023) 
I did my PhD at the MARBEC lab at the
University of Montpellier (France). I
developped new tools to estimate the temporal variability of fishes diversity
and functional roles based on cameras approaches. Using these tools, I studied
how functional roles varied at within-day and between-day scales in temperate
and tropical coastal ecosystems. Then, I have assessed how this temporal
variation at short temporal scale can affect our perception of Protected Areas
effect. I have found that within-day and between-day variability in species
functional roles is high and that functional processes (such as herbivory or
corallivory) are mainly realised during intense activity events. Thus measuring
functional processes on short temporal scales can biais their estimation.

Co-organised workshops
2022
I had the opportunity to co-organise a Workshop on Functional Rarity and Diversity in Ecology led by the FRB-CESAB and the FREE Research Group. During this workshop, we did a practical on the use of the mFD and the funrar R packages.

2022

My colleagues and I had the opportunity to speak in front of about 450 persons, it was an incredible experience! My talk in french here.
